before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5diqe","text":"Do aliquots of 1 mL of sterile milliQ water.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg6sg","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d9td","text":"Before starting, place all the supplies and sterile milliQ Water needed for the PCR under the PCR hood and switch on the UV light for at least 20 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"acek4","text":"Nowadays metabarcoding approaches allow to explore the diversity of different communities using next-generation sequencing (NGS).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ikjt","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bho1f","text":"Here we describe the 16S-V4V5 DNA amplification method applied for prokaryote metabarcoding analyses using Illumina Miseq technology. This protocol has been used in many projects studying prokaryotic diversity (TARA-OCEANS 2009-2013, TARA-PACIFIC 2016-2018), and prokaryote monitoring projects (ROSCOFF ASTAN 2009-ongoing).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87d4","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adc15","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jb4l","text":"We developed the flowchart for 2 different sequencing platforms : Fasteris-Gene Support SA (Plan-Les-Ouates, Swiss) and GeT-PlaGE (Toulouse, France).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Tagged-Primer Design for Fasteris platform
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8v0jo","text":"Amplicons from each DNA sample are all pooled in a single microtube. Each pool of amplicons will be considered as a \"library sample \" or called \"Pooled Amplicons\" and loaded on a Miseq 2x250 run.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":144,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nb9p","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u8v9","text":"To allow the latter separation of each sample in the Pooled Amplicon sample, each DNA is amplified using forward tagged primer built with a structure 5'-NNNN-MID-forwardprimer'. The reverse primer is not modified.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kqpb","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hkmu","text":"The tag, or Multiplex IDentifier (MID) is a unique short sequence of 7 or 8 bases compatible with the forward primer V4f and generated using the matrix oligoTag program (Coissac et al. 2012). We also added 4 N at the 5' extremity of the forward primer to help MID sequence conservation during the cluster synthesis step on the Flowcell.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54u54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48r62","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27mnn","text":" steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"60ef5","text":"Lyophilized Tagged-primers are obtained at Eurogentec, using the RP-Cartridge Gold purification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d83c4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akfs8","text":"Work always under the PCR hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hq07","text":"PCR reactions are performed using the Taq polymerase GoTaq G2 Flexi polymerase (Promega, Cat No M7806).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c52ud","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f901c","text":"Keep the same annealing temperature as the one is used with the usual 16S-V4V5 primer set.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vit7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3lib","text":"First test each of your taggeg-primer sets on a positive and a negative control following steps 5, 6, 7 and 8.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q2c5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e93pq","text":"Then you can perform DNA sample amplification following next steps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gjpc","text":"PCR Programm :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5scjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"appaf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2g2cv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a94u2","text":"In order to reduce the artificial building of chimeras during the PCR process, the # of cycles must be reduced to a minimum : 25, max 30 (chimeras formation mainly during the plateau-phase of the PCR reaction).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tn1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2975E510416411EC8C50F352F9352FD8","height":167,"id":208627,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"PCRprogramm 16S.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fwhw9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmzv9ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmzu9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bocq","text":"Mix 1 vol of sample with 2 volumes of buffer NT.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oiic","text":"Follow the instructions of manufacturer (mentioned in the Step 9), except for the elution step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdijc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cl6e","text":"Elution Step : ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3djs4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ggia","text":"- Place the NucleoSpin PCR Clean-Up Column into a clean 1.5mL microtube correctly labeled (sample, target tagged-MID, date).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l86f","text":"- Add 22 µL buffer NE preheated at 65°C directly onto the column and incubate 5 min @ 65°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"256ck","text":"- Centrifuge 1 min @ 11 000 g.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fp3e","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5udk0","text":"Store the purified PCR products at -20°C or directly do the quantification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f67h8","text":"PCR products are quantified using the quantification kit: Quant-iT™ PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent *2000 assays* (Invitrogen, cat nb P7581) and a Fluorometer Plate readerFluorometer Plate reader, following the manufacturer's protocol.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ec6k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt8i3","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7u8dg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"0E150E58416511ECAF8E0A58A9FEAC02","id":184342,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Quant-it Picogreen dsDNA kit.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fway9ufn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hfcj","text":"After quantification of the PCR products, amplicons will be pooled before shipment to  the NGS Fasteris sequencing platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79fve","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9de5h","text":"One final tube (called \"Pooled Amplicons\") will contain all pooled amplicons at equimolar concentration, ready for the library preparation. The amounts and volume required by Fasteris are : 1μg of equimolar amplicon pool in 30 μl (so Pool Amplicons concentration should be \u003e35 ng/µL) .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":190,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a346n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26mfa","text":"The volume of each amplicon that will added in the tube \"Pooled Amplicons\" is calculated based on their average concentration as follows :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ford8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dala","text":"Calculation table for Pooled Amplicons preparation :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"887q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9e21","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2obok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5plj5","text":"If the final volume of Pooled Amplicons is higher than 30 µL, (so concentration inferior to 35ng/µL), an additionnal concentration step will be necessary. For this we used the purification kit: NucleoSpin® PCR Clean-Up (Macherey-Nagel, cat. nb 740609.50 or 740609.250 ).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":194,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"84283560416611EC8C50F352F9352FD8","height":270,"id":208635,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Pool amplicons_annotated_16S.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz79ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz59ufn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz69ufn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz49ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"diuf1","text":"Elute dried primers at 100 µM with TE 1X sterile buffer under a PCR hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83hbb","text":"Primer dissolution is done for 15 min at room temperature under the hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b38ae","text":"Short vortex and spin.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h34u","text":"Primer working solutions are then prepared at 10 µM with sterile milliQ water molecular grade.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f99jl","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i7vi","text":"For each MID-primer, add 10 µL of 100 µM of Stock primer to 90 µL in a 1.5mL sterile microtube correctly labeled (MID###, concentration, date, operator).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l9t6","text":"Stock primers and primer working solutions are stored at -20°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"uv4g","text":"If you work on environmental sample : ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12rj1","text":"Dispense 28 µL of each tagged-MID-primer PCR mix preparations per well under the PCR hood, and then add 2 µL of the DNA template on the bench.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ckfrv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68dds","text":"If you work on strain sample : ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rjor","text":"Dispense 26 µL of each tagged-MID-primer PCR mix preparations per well under the PCR hood (so reduce the volume of H2O milliQ in the Master Mix), and then add 4 µL of the DNA template on the bench to get 5-10ng in the MasterMix.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avv5t","text":"PCR plate's plan :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u15v","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n6p1","text":"Each DNA sample (DNA1, DNA2, DNA3...) will be amplified with its own tagged-MID-primer (515fY-M8R001, 515fY-M8R004, 515fY-M8R005...). So there will be as many PCR mix preparations as there are DNA samples to amplify.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":134,"length":82}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qdot","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5cj5","text":"In order to get enough material (50 ng), triplicate the PCR reactions on each DNA sample (you will pool them after).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ojct","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hbve","text":"One positive control and one negative control will be added for each PCR mix preparation.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99hvr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbbcq","text":"PCR reactions are prepared on a semi-skirted 96-wells PCR plate (like AB-0900 PCR plate).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"468da","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em7uc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9j21","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E66B8A764DF411ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","height":173,"id":208659,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"PCR plate.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fzzp9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm2v9ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm2u9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}
